item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, September 12, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: iFixit created a new USB-C, repairable soldering system (294 points | 121 comments)
2. GAZEploit: Remote keystroke inference attack by gaze estimation in VR/MR devices (108 points | 62 comments)
3. Can LLMs Generate Novel Research Ideas? (32 points | 39 comments)
4. Show HN: Galaxy Visualization (6 points | discuss)
5. OpenAI O1 Model (8 points | 1 comment)
6. Artie (YC S23) Is Hiring a Founding Designer ( | hide)
7. Kolmogorov-Arnold networks may make neural networks more understandable (165 points | 49 comments)
8. If I could dissect a sauropod (62 points | 7 comments)
9. Why Haskell? (218 points | 304 comments)
10. Ergo: Erlang-inspired event driven actor framework in Go (85 points | 42 comments)
11. Show HN: Goroutine Monitor Powered by eBPF (30 points | 1 comment)
12. Peer Gynt quilt, Part 1 (2021) (41 points | 3 comments)
13. Show HN: Repogather – copy relevant files to clipboard for LLM coding workflows (25 points | 20 comments)
14. Linear, symmetric, self-selecting 14-bit molecular memristors (2023) (83 points | 45 comments)
15. DEF Con 32 – AMD Sinkclose Universal Ring-2 Privilege Escalation (Not Redacted) [pdf] (151 points | 13 comments)
16. Qubit Transistors Reach Error Correction Benchmark (41 points | 8 comments)
17. Show HN: Konty – A Balsamiq-alternative lo-fi wireframe tool for modern apps (309 points | 114 comments)
18. Large-Scale Generation of Transit Maps from OpenStreetMap Data (215 points | 24 comments)
19. 1913: When Hitler, Trotsky, Tito, Freud and Stalin all lived in the same place (25 points | 9 comments)
20. Exponential Rate Limiting (58 points | 10 comments)
21. Jax and Equinox: What are they and why should I bother? (3 points | discuss)
22. Old Easter Island genomes show no sign of a population collapse (67 points | 25 comments)
23. A MiniGolf game for Palm OS (300 points | 92 comments)
24. Why Oxide Chose Illumos (165 points | 97 comments)
25. Critical Resources and the First 14 KB (2022) (42 points | 5 comments)
26. Be a thermostat, not a thermometer (2023) (235 points | 111 comments)
27. We spent $20 to achieve RCE and accidentally became the admins of .mobi (1473 points | 334 comments)
28. Reader-LM: Small Language Models for Cleaning and Converting HTML to Markdown (166 points | 36 comments)
29. Wild Mustang and Burro Freeze Marks (2020) [pdf] (24 points | 15 comments)
30. AppleWatchAmmeter (317 points | 64 comments)
